column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: ethnonym. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://www.example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .:Ethnonym rdf:type rdf:Class .:hasEthnonym rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdf:domain :Person ;    rdf:range :Ethnonym .:Person rdf:type rdf:Class .:personA rdf:type :Person ;  :hasEthnonym :ethnonymF .:ethnonymF rdf:type :Ethnonym ;    rdf:label "French" .```  In the ontology above, we define two classes, `Ethnonym` and `Person`. We also create a property `hasEthnonym` which relates a person to his/her ethnonym. As an example of how this ontology could be used, we define `personA` as an instance of `Person` and `ethnonymF` as an instance of `Ethnonym`. We use the `hasEthnonym` property to specify that `personA`'s ethnonym is `ethnonymF`, and we label `ethnonymF` as "French".
